Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different plants and animals, including humans, in their correct habitats.
The student can draw and label the places where different animals and plants live.
The student can illustrate and label the resources needed by the plants and animals in the drawing, such as water, air, sunlight, soil, rocks, and food.
The student can show how the needs of the animals and plants are met by where they live, such as fish in water and plants in sunny spots.
The student can depict and label the interactions between plants, animals, and their environments, showing how these parts work together as a system.
